Post._content: ShellLinux,,.(bash shell) ----- ## **-x**. ,110: ``` #!/bin/bash for i in {1..10} do echo $i done ``` **-x**: ``` # export PS4='+${BASH_SOURCE}:${LINENO}:${FUNCNAME[0]}: ' # sh -x test.sh # +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 1 1 +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 2 2 +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 3 3 +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 4 4 +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 5 5 +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 6 6 +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 7 7 +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 8 8 +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 9 9 +test.sh:3:: for i in '{1..10}' +test.sh:5:: echo 10 10 ``` ,,: ``` set -x # set +x # set -v # set +v # ``` **set builtin**. : ``` #!/bin/bash for i in {1..10} do set -x echo $i set +x done ``` : ``` +test.sh:6:: echo 1 1 +test.sh:7:: set +x +test.sh:6:: echo 2 2 +test.sh:7:: set +x +test.sh:6:: echo 3 3 +test.sh:7:: set +x +test.sh:6:: echo 4 4 +test.sh:7:: set +x +test.sh:6:: echo 5 5 +test.sh:7:: set +x +test.sh:6:: echo 6 6 +test.sh:7:: set +x +test.sh:6:: echo 7 7 +test.sh:7:: set +x +test.sh:6:: echo 8 8 +test.sh:7:: set +x +test.sh:6:: echo 9 9 +test.sh:7:: set +x +test.sh:6:: echo 10 10 +test.sh:7:: set +x ``` ## bash,.,,_DEBUG: ``` #!/bin/bash # run:_DEBUG=on sh debug.sh function DEBUG() { [ "$_DEBUG" == "on" ] && $@ || : } for i in {1..5} do DEBUG echo -e "This is debug line!" echo $i done ``` _DEBUG,. : ``` [aidu1602@ResU10 tools]$ _DEBUG=on sh debug.sh This is debug line! int say(char *what) { printf("------ %s\n", what); return 0; } ``` `main.c` ``` #include extern int say(const char *); int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) { if (argv[1]) { say("hello"); } else { say("bye"); } return 0; } ``` `-fprofile-arcs -ftest-coverage -fPIC``*.gcno` ``` $ gcc -fprofile-arcs -ftest-coverage -fPIC -O0 say.c main.c $ ls a.out main.c main.gcno say.c say.gcno ``` ### `*.gcda``*.o``*.c`: ``` $ ./a.out ------ bye $ ls a.out main.c main.gcda main.gcno say.c say.gcda say.gcno ``` `GCOV_PREFIX=/xxx/xxx``GCOV_PREFIX_STRIP=x``GCOV_PREFIX_STRIP``0``/a/b/c/d.c``GCOV_PREFIX_STRIP=2``c/d.c``GCOV_PREFIX=/e/f``.gcda``/e/f/c/d.gcda` ### `*.gcov` ``` $ gcov -a main.c File 'main.c' Lines executed:80.00% of 5 Creating 'main.c.gcov' ``` [Invoking gcov](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/Invoking-Gcov.html#Invoking-Gcov) ``` -b -a -f ``` ### 1. 2. `gcov` 3. 4. `*.gcno``*.gcda` 5. `-lgcov` ### `gcov``*.gcov``lcov``gcovr``gcovr``Python`KB[](https://gcovr.com/installation.html) #### 1. ``` $ gcovr -r . ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ 50% ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ ``` `main.c` #### XML ``` $ gcovr --xml-pretty -r . . ``` #### HTML ``` $ gcovr -r . --html -o xxx.html $ ls a.out Post.title: RPATHRUNPATH
Post._content:
`RPATH`  `RUNPATH` 

-----
<!--more-->

# RPATHRUNPATH


## 
`main.c` 
```c
#include "a.h"

int main() {
	a();
	return 0;
}
```
`libA.so`
```c
// a.c
#include "b.h"

void a() {
	b();
}
```
```c
// a.h
void a();
```
`ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)`
```bash
$ gcc -fPIC -shared a.c -I. -L. -lB -o libA.so
```
`libB.so`
```c
// b.c
#include <stdio.h>

void b() {
	printf("Hello, World\n");
}
```
```c
// b.h
void b();
```
`ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)`
```bash
$ gcc -fPIC -shared -I. b.c -o libB.so
```


> **`main` -> `a` -> `b`**



## 

1.  `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)`  `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` 
```bash
$ gcc -I. -o main main.c -Wl,--rpath,. -L. -lA -lB
```


2.  `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` ****
```bash
$ ./main
Hello, World
```

3.  `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` ****
```bash
$ ./main 
./main: error while loading shared libraries: libB.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```
>  `./main`  `libB.so` 



## 
### 
 `libA.so`  `libB.so`  `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)`  `libA.so`  `libB.so` `libA.so`  `libB.so` 


### 
 **`LD_DEBUG`**
`ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)`
```bash
$ LD_DEBUG=libs ./main                                                        [16:37:15]
     22331:	find library=libA.so [0]; searching
     22331:	 search path=./tls/x86_64:./tls:./x86_64:.		(RPATH from file ./main)
......
     22331:	  trying file=./libA.so
......
     22331:	find library=libB.so [0]; searching
     22331:	 search path=./tls/x86_64:./tls:./x86_64:.		(RPATH from file ./main)
......
     22331:	  trying file=./libB.so
 ......
```
`ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)`
```bash
$ LD_DEBUG=libs ./main
     33218:	find library=libA.so [0]; searching
     33218:	 search path=./tls/haswell/x86_64:./tls/haswell:./tls/x86_64:./tls:./haswell/x86_64:./haswell:./x86_64:.		(RUNPATH from file ./main)
......
     33218:	  trying file=./libA.so
......
     33218:	find library=libB.so [0]; searching
     33218:	 search cache=/etc/ld.so.cache
     33218:	 search path=/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/haswell/x86_64:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/haswell:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/x86_64:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/haswell/x86_64:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/haswell:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/x86_64:/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/haswell/x86_64:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/haswell:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls/x86_64:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/tls:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/haswell/x86_64:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/haswell:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/x86_64:/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu:/lib/tls/haswell/x86_64:/lib/tls/haswell:/lib/tls/x86_64:/lib/tls:/lib/haswell/x86_64:/lib/haswell:/lib/x86_64:/lib:/usr/lib/tls/haswell/x86_64:/usr/lib/tls/haswell:/usr/lib/tls/x86_64:/usr/lib/tls:/usr/lib/haswell/x86_64:/usr/lib/haswell:/usr/lib/x86_64:/usr/lib		(system search path)
......
./main: error while loading shared libraries: libB.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

```
 `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)`   `libA.so`  `libB.so` 
`libB.so`  `system search path`  `./`  `libB.so` 
> 
> 1. `LD_LIBRARY_PATH``-L`  `-rpath`
> 1. `/etc/ld.so.cache`
> 1. `/usr/lib``/lib`



### RPATHRUNPATH
 `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`  `-rpath` 
`ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)`
```bash
$ readelf -d main
Dynamic section at offset 0xe08 contains 26 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libA.so]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
 0x000000000000000f (RPATH)              Library rpath: [.]
 
 $ readelf -d libA.so
Dynamic section at offset 0xe08 contains 25 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libB.so]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
 
 $ readelf -d libB.so
Dynamic section at offset 0xe18 contains 24 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
```
`ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)`
```bash
$ readelf -d main 
Dynamic section at offset 0x2da8 contains 29 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libA.so]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
 0x000000000000001d (RUNPATH)            Library runpath: [.]
 
 $ readelf -d libA.so 
Dynamic section at offset 0xe08 contains 25 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libB.so]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
 
 $ readelf -d libB.so 
Dynamic section at offset 0xe18 contains 24 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
```
 `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)`  `RPATH`  `RUNPATH`  `-rpath` 
> `main` -> `libA.so` -> `libB.so`



** `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0) ` `-rpath`  `RUNPATH`  `RPATH` `RUNPATH`  `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)`  `libA.so`  `libB.so` **
> `gcc version >= 7.5.0``-rpath`



## 
### LD_LIBRARY_PATH
`LD_LIBRARY_PATH` ****
```bash
$ export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:./libs
```


1.  `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`
1.  `LD_LIBRARY_PATH`



### --disable-new-dtags
 `-Wl,--disable-new-dtags`  `ubuntu 20.04(gcc version 9.3.0)` 
```bash
$ gcc -I. -o main main.c -Wl,--disable-new-dtags,--rpath,. -L. -lA -lB
```

```bash
$ ./main 
Hello, World

$ readelf -d main
Dynamic section at offset 0x2da8 contains 29 entries:
  Tag        Type                         Name/Value
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libA.so]
 0x0000000000000001 (NEEDED)             Shared library: [libc.so.6]
 0x000000000000000f (RPATH)              Library rpath: [.]
```
 `main` `RUNPATH`  `RPATH` `ubuntu 16.04(gcc version 5.4.0)` 
>  `-Wl,--enable-new-dtags` 




```
--enable-new-dtags
--disable-new-dtags
This linker can create the new dynamic tags in ELF. But the older ELF systems may not understand them. If you specify --enable-new-dtags, the new dynamic tags will be created as needed and older dynamic tags will be omitted. If you specify --disable-new-dtags, no new dynamic tags will be created. By default, the new dynamic tags are not created. Note that those options are only available for ELF systems.
```
## 

- [How to set RPATH and RUNPATH with GCC/LD?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52018092/how-to-set-rpath-and-runpath-with-gcc-ld)
- [use RPATH but not RUNPATH?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7967848/use-rpath-but-not-runpath)

Post._content: `clone``https` ---------- ## `web``1.5G``git clone` ``` remote: Counting objects: 10994, done. remote: Compressing objects: 100% (3085/3085), done. error: RPC failed; curl 56 GnuTLS recv error (-110): The TLS connection was non-properly terminated. fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly fatal: early EOF fatal: index-pack failed ``` ### postBuffer `postBuffer``ssl` ``` $ git config --global http.postBuffer 2048000000 # 2G $ git config --global http.sslVerify false # sslVerify ``` `clone` ### opensslgunssl 1. ``` $ sudo apt-get install build-essential fakeroot dpkg-dev libcurl4-openssl-dev ``` 2.git ``` $ sudo apt-get source git ``` ``` E: You must put some 'source' URIs in your sources.list ``` ->`Software & Updates`->`Ubuntu Software`->`Source code` ![source_code](source_code.png) ``` couldn't be accessed by user '_apt'. - pkgAcquire::Run (13: Permission denied) [duplicate] ``` ``` sudo chown _apt /var/lib/update-notifier/package-data-downloads/partial/ ``` 3.`git` ``` $ sudo apt-get build-dep git ``` 4.`git` ``` $ cd git-2.7.4/ $ vim ./debian/control # libcurl4-gnutls-devlibcurl4-openssl-dev $ vim ./debian/rules # TEST=test $ sudo dpkg-buildpackage -rfakeroot -b -uc -us -j4 # ``` 5. ``` $ cd .. $ sudo dpkg -i git_2.7.4-0ubuntuxxx_amd64.deb # ``` `clone` ## ``` remote: Counting objects: 10994, done. remote: Compressing objects: 100% (3085/3085), done. error: RPC failed; curl 18 transfer closed with outstanding read data remaining fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly fatal: early EOF fatal: index-pack failed ``` `postBuffer` ``` $ cat ~/.gitconfig [http] sslVerify = false postBuffer = 2048000000 ``` ### clone `clone` ``` $ git clone --depth=1 http://xxx.git ``` `clone` ``` $ git fetch --unshallow # $ git remote set-branches origin '*' # $ git fetch -v # ``` `clone` ## Reference ## About me [![forthebadge](http://forthebadge.com/images/badges/ages-20-30.svg)](http://forthebadge.com) - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[http://www.answerywj.com](http://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[@AnSwEr](http://weibo.com/1783591593) - CSDN[AnSwEr](http://blog.csdn.net/u011192270) This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. - 4.0

Post._content: . ## `hello.c`: ``` #include __attribute__ ((visibility ("default"))) void hello() { printf("Hello World!\n"); } ``` `hello.h`: ``` #ifndef __HELLO__H #define __HELLO__H #ifdef __cplusplus extern "C" { #endif void hello(); #ifdef __cplusplus } #endif #endif ``` `bye.c`: ``` #include void bye() { printf("Bye Bye!\n"); } ``` `bye.h`: ``` #ifndef __BYE__H #define __BYE__H #ifdef __cplusplus extern "C" { #endif void bye(); #ifdef __cplusplus } #endif #endif ``` ## `-fvisibility=hidden`,;`__attribute__ ((visibility ("default")))`: ``` $ gcc -fvisibility=hidden -I. -c hello.c -o hello.o $ gcc -fvisibility=hidden -I. -c bye.c -o bye.o ``` `hello()`,`bye()`. ## `.o``libt.o`: ``` $ ld -r hello.o bye.o -o libt.o ``` ## ``` $ strip --strip-unneeded libt.o ``` ## () ``` $ objcopy --localize-hidden libt.o libt_hidden.o ``` ## ``` $ ar crv libt.a libt_hidden.o ``` ## ### `hello()` `test1.c`: ``` #include "hello.h" int main(void) { hello(); return 0; } ``` ``` $ gcc -I. test1.c -L. -lt -o test $ ./test Hello World! ``` ### `bye()` test2.c ``` #include "bye.h" int main(void) { bye(); return 0; } ``` ``` $ gcc -I. test2.c -L. -lt -o test $ ./test /tmp/ccdaJT7s.o: In function `main': test2.c:(.text+0xa): undefined reference to `bye' collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status ``` ## Reference ## About me [![forthebadge](http://forthebadge.com/images/badges/ages-20-30.svg)](http://forthebadge.com) - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[http://www.answerywj.com](http://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[@AnSwEr](http://weibo.com/1783591593) - CSDN[AnSwEr](http://blog.csdn.net/u011192270) This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. - 4.0

Post.title: Git
Post._content:
[Git](https://answerywj.com/2019/02/12/git-help-v2/)

-----
<!--more-->

## Git

### 
> `Git`[https://git-scm.com/downloads](https://git-scm.com/downloads)`v1.8` 

`Git`
```
$ git --version
```

### 
`Git`
- `--system` `/etc/gitconfig`
- `--global` `~/.gitconfig`
- `--local` `[repo]/.git/config`**

`global``Git`
```
$ git config --global --unset user.name
$ git config --global --unset user.email
```


```
$ git config --local user.name "username"
$ git config --local user.email "email"
```

`Git`
```
$ git config --global credential.helper store
```
> 


```
$ git config --global credential.helper 'cache --timeout=3600'
```

`v2.13.0`
-  `.gitconfig` `includeIf` 
```diff
- [user]
- 	name = weijie.yuan
- 	email = weijie.yuan@gitlab.com

+ [includeIf "gitdir:~/github/"]
+     path = .gitconfig-github
+ [includeIf "gitdir:~/gitlab/"]
+     path = .gitconfig-gitlab
```

-  `path` `.gitconfig-github`  `.gitconfig-gitlab` 
```
$ vi .gitconfig-github
[user]
	name = weijie.yuan
	email = weijie.yuan@github.com

$ vi .gitconfig-gitlab
[user]
	name = weijie.yuan
	email = weijie.yuan@gitlab.com
```
`includeIf` 
-  `.gitconfig` `includeIf`  `path`  `/` 
-  `.gitconfig`  `user` 
-  `.gitconfig` `includeIf`

### 
`Git``SSH``HTTPS``SSH``Git``HTTPS`

#### SSH
`SSH``id_rsa.pub``Git``SSH keys`
```
$ ls ~/.ssh
```


- `Git`
```
$ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@youremail.com"
```
- `Git`
```
$ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@youremail.com" -f "git1_id_rsa"
$ ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "your_email@youremail.com" -f "git2_id_rsa

# 
$ vi ~/.ssh/config
# git1
Host git1.com
HostName git1.com
PreferredAuthentications publickey
IdentityFile ~/.ssh/git1_id_rsa

# git2
Host git2.com
HostName git2.com
PreferredAuthentications publickey
IdentityFile ~/.ssh/git2_id_rsa
```

ssh
```
$ ssh -T git@github.com
Hi! Youve successfully authenticated, but GitHub does not provide shell access.
```
> 


```
$ git clone git@git.server:test.git
```


#### HTTPS
`ssl`
```
$ git config --global http.sslverify false
```


```
$ git clone https://git.server/test.git
```

### 
`diff``merge``git difftool --tool-help``meld`
- `Linux` or `MacOS`
```
$ git config --global diff.tool meld
$ git config --global merge.tool meld
```
- `Windows`

```
> git config --global diff.tool meld
> git config --global merge.tool meld
> git config --global difftool.bc3.path 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Meld\Meld.exe'
> git config --global mergetool.meld.path 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Meld\Meld.exe'
> git config --global difftool.meld.path 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Meld\Meld.exe'
```


```
$ git config --global color.ui.true
```

`Git`
```
$ git config --global alias checkout co 
```
> `checkout``co`

### 
```
$ git config --local --list
$ git config --global --list
$ git config --system --list
```

## 
![](git-work-flow.jpg)

`.git``stage``index``Git``master``master``HEAD`  

  
1. `git add`
2. `git commit`

## 

```
$ git clone git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git
```


```
$ cd repo
$ git init
$ git remote add origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git
```
> `origin``git`


```
$ git add <filename> 
$ git add .  #   
$ git add *  # 
```


```
$ git commit -m "commit message"
$ git commit -am "commit message" # am
```
> ``commit message``[ Git Commit  7 ](http://blog.jobbole.com/92713/)



```
$ git push -u origin <feature-branch-name>
```
> ``-u``,``git pull``.[](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5697750/what-exactly-does-the-u-do-git-push-u-origin-master-vs-git-push-origin-ma)


```
$ git remote -v
origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (push)
origin git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (fetch)
```


```
$ git remote add upstream git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git
```

`fork`
``` 
$ git remote -v
origin  git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (push)
origin  git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (fetch)
upstream  git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git  (push)
upstream  git@github.com:USERNAME/repo.git (fetch)

$ git fetch upstream 
$ git difftool <branch-name> upstream/master
$ git merge upstream/master
$ git mergetool
```

`Git```submodule````subtree``[subtree](http://aoxuis.me/post/2013-08-06-git-subtree)
``` 
# 
$ git remote add -f <remote-subtree-repository-name> <remote-subtree-repository-url>
$ git subtree add --prefix=<local-subtree-directory> <remote-subtree-repository> <remote-subtree-branch-name> --squash

# subtree
$ git subtree pull --prefix=<local-subtree-directory> <remote-subtree-repository> <remote-subtree-branch-name> --squash

# subtree
$ git subtree push --prefix=<local-subtree-directory> <remote-subtree-repository> <remote-subtree-branch-name>
```

## 
``*``
```
$ git branch -a
```


```
$ git branch <newbranch>
```


```
$ git checkout -b <newbranch>
```


```
$ git branch <branch> <tagname>
$ git checkout <branch> # 
```


```
$ git push -u origin <remote-branch-name>
  or
$ git push --set-upstream origin <remote-branch-name>
```


```
$ git branch -d <branch>
```
> ``-D``

()
```
$ git push origin --delete <remote-branch-name>
$ git push origin -d <remote-branch-name>
$ git push origin :<remote-branch-name>
```


```
$ git remote prune origin
```
> remote


```
$ git branch --set-upstream <local-branch> origin/branch
```


```
$ git checkout -b <local-branch> <remote-branch>
```

``git pull``
```
# , origin/<branch-name>
$ git fetch origin <branch-name> 
# 
$ git difftool <branch-name> origin/<branch-name>
#  
$ git merge origin/<branch-name>
# mergetool              
$ git mergetool                               
```

``master``
```
$ git fetch origin master
$ git difftool <branch-name> origin/master
$ git merge origin/master
$ git mergetool
```

`<commit id>`:
```
$ git branch -a --contains <commit id>
```

## 

```
$ git tag
```


``` 
$ git tag -a <tagname> -m "tag message" # commit
$ git tag -a <tagname> -m "tag message" <commit id> # commit
```


```
$ git push origin <tagname> # 
$ git push origin --tags # 
```


```
$ git tag -d <tagname> # 
$ git push origin :refs/tags/<tagname> # 
```

## 

```
$ git status
```


```
$ git difftool <filename>
$ git mergetool <filename>
```


```
$ git log
$ git log --pretty=oneline #commit id  commit message
```

``Tracked files``
```
$ git checkout -- <filename>
```

``Untracked files``
- n
- f`Untracked`
- d`Untracked`
- x`gitignore``Untracked`  

```
git clean -nfd
```

(`git commit`)(`git add`)
```
$ git reset --mixed HEAD^ # --mixed
$ git reset HEAD^
```

(`git commit`)(`git add`)
```
$ git reset --soft HEAD^
```

(`git commit`)(`git add`)(``Untracked files``)`<commit-id>`
```
$ git reset --hard <commit-id>
```
> `HEAD```HEAD^````HEAD^^``100``HEAD~100``

``commit id``
```
$ git reflog
```


```
$ git rm <filename>
```

``push``
```
$ git revert <commit-id>
```
> ``revert````commit````commit``;``reset````commit````push``

## 

```
$ git stash save "message"
```

:
```
$ git stash list
```

:
```
$ git stash pop [--index] [stash@{num}]
  or
$ git stash apply [--index] [stash@{num}]# .
```
> ``--index``,``num``,

:
```
$ git stash drop [stash@{num}] # 
$ git stash clear # 
```

## 
### 
```
$ git branch -d <branch-name>
$ git tag -d <tag-name>
$ git remote prune origin
$ git pull
```

### 
- `git`
```
$ git count-objects -v
$ du -sh .git
```

- `ID`
```
$ git verify-pack -v .git/objects/pack/*.idx | sort -k 3 -n | tail -10
```
> `ID``blob``tree`10

- `ID`
```
$ git rev-list --objects --all | grep "$(git verify-pack -v .git/objects/pack/*.idx | sort -k 3 -n | tail -10 | awk '{print$1}')"
```

- 
```
$ git filter-branch --tree-filter 'rm -rf xxx' HEAD --all
$ git pull
```

- `.git`
```
$ git gc --prune=now
```
> `push``git``gc``loose object`

### 
`Git`[](http://www.oschina.net/news/71365/git-annex-lfs-bigfiles-fat-media-bigstore-sym)

## 
``git status````Untracked``

### 
``.gitignore``
```
tmp/  # tmp
*.ini # ini
!data/ #data
```
> [``.gitignore``](https://github.com/github/gitignore)

### 
``.gitignore_global````.gitignore````~/.gitconfig``
```
[core]
	excludesfile = ~/.gitignore_global
```

`Tracked`,`Untracked`:
```
$ git rm -r --cached .
```

## 
### 
```
$ git rebase -i [git-hash| head~n]
$ git push -f #  push  merge 
```
> `git-hash``rebase``commit``hash``head~n``HEAD``n``commit`


### 
```
git filter-branch --commit-filter '
        if [ "$GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL" = "xxx@localhost" ];
        then
                GIT_AUTHOR_NAME="xxx";
                GIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL="xxx@example.com";
                git commit-tree "$@";
        else
                git commit-tree "$@";
        fi' HEAD --all
```

## 

```
$ git --help
```

Youve successfully authenticated, but GitHub does not provide shell access. ``` https, , ``` $ git config --global http.sslverify false $ git config --global credential.helper 'cache --timeout=3600' ``` diffmerge, linuxmelddiffuse ``` $ git config --global diff.tool meld $ git config --global merge.tool meld ``` ,, `pull/push` ``` $ git config --global credential.helper store # , ``` , ``` $ git config --global color.ui.true ``` ``` $ git config --global alias checkout co ``` > ``checkout````co`` , ``` $ git config --local --list $ git config --global --list $ git config --system --list ``` ## Post.title: --hash-style
Post._content:
`--hash-style` 

-----
<!--more-->

## 
```
dlopen failed: empty/missing DT_HASH in "libxxx.so" (built with --hash-style=gnu?)
```


## 
``

- `DT_HASH`
```
ELF  Sections
```

- `--hash-style=style`( `man ld`)
```
Set the type of linker's hash table(s). style can be either "sysv" for classic ELF ".hash" section, "gnu" for new style GNU ".gnu.hash" section or "both" for both the classic ELF ".hash" and new style GNU ".gnu.hash" hash tables. The default is "sysv".
```

## 
 `--hash-style=style`  `style` `sysv``gnu``both`

- `gcc -Wl,--hash-style=sysv`
```
$ readelf -S libxxx.so  | grep "hash"
[ 4] .hash             HASH             0000000000003120  00003120
```

- `gcc -Wl,--hash-style=gnu`
```
$ readelf -S libxxx.so  | grep "hash"
[ 4] .gnu.hash         GNU_HASH         0000000000003120  00003120
```

- `gcc -Wl,--hash-style=both`
```
$ readelf -S libxxx.so  | grep "hash"
  [ 4] .gnu.hash         GNU_HASH         0000000000003120  00003120
  [ 5] .hash             HASH             00000000000035f8  000035f8
```

> `-Wl`   
  
`Sections Name` 

> `.gnu.hash`  `hash`  `hash`  `50%`  [https://blogs.oracle.com/solaris/gnu-hash-elf-sections-v2](https://blogs.oracle.com/solaris/gnu-hash-elf-sections-v2)

## 

```
libxxx.so  DT_HASH  --hash-style=gnu ?
```
 `--hash-style=gnu` `Section Name`  `.gnu.hash` `.hash` 

 `Makefile` 

```
$ gcc -dumpspecs | grep "hash"
... --hash-style=gnu ...
```

> `-dumpspecs` 

 `--hash-style`  `gnu`

## 
 `--hash-style`  `gnu` `--hash-style`  `gnu` 

## 
 `--hash-style`  `both`
```
LDFLAGS += -Wl,--hash-style=both
```

## 
- [Only one --hash-style in embedded Linux. Why?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11741816/only-one-hash-style-in-embedded-linux-why)
- [Binaries built on RHEL5 or FC6 do not work on RHEL4 or FC5!](https://sites.google.com/site/avinesh/binaryincompatibilitybetweenrhel4andrhel)
- [Android NDK UnsatisfiedLinkError: dlopen failed: empty/missing DT_HASH](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28638809/android-ndk-unsatisfiedlinkerror-dlopen-failed-empty-missing-dt-hash)
- [Trouble understanding gcc linker options](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42068271/trouble-understanding-gcc-linker-options)

-----

Post._content: [OpenResty ](http://www.stuq.org/course/1015/study) ## OpenResty ### 1.1 OpenResty - >SSD>>> - ### 1.2 hello world - [](http://openresty.org/en/) - [](https://github.com/openresty/lua-nginx-module/blob/master/README.markdown) `OpenResty = Nginx + LuaJITLuaJITNginx worker` [lua_code_cache](https://github.com/openresty/lua-nginx-module#lua_code_cache)`lua``set_by_lua_file``content_by_lua_file``lua`Nginx [content_by_lua_file](https://github.com/openresty/lua-nginx-module#content_by_lua_file)`lua` ### 1.3 OpenResty [openresty](https://moonbingbing.gitbooks.io/openresty-best-practices/content/index.html) `logs/error.log` `nginx.conf` ``` location = /api/random { content_by_lua_file lua/random.lua; } ``` `random.lua` ``` local args = ngx.req.get_uri_args() --max is 100set 0 to unlimit local salt = args.salt if not salt then ngx.exit(ngx.HTTP_BAD_REQUEST) end local string = ngx.md5(ngx.time() .. salt) ngx.say(string) ``` ### 1.4 ngx lua API > Tips `lua API``ngx lua API` ### 1.5 > Tips [lua-resty-redis](https://github.com/openresty/lua-resty-redis)[lua-resty-mysql](https://github.com/openresty/lua-resty-mysql) ### 1.6 OpenResty - [share_dict](https://github.com/openresty/lua-nginx-module#ngxshareddict) `worker` - [lua-resty-lrucache](https://github.com/openresty/lua-resty-lrucache)`key``worker` [lua-resty-lock](https://github.com/openresty/lua-resty-lock) ### 1.7 FFI `FFI``LuaJIT``LuaJIT``C``C`[random.lua](https://github.com/openresty/lua-resty-string/blob/master/lib/resty/random.lua) `/openresty/lualib/resty` ### 1.8 `ngx.location.capture``ngx.location.capture_multi``location``location``http``C`; `down``api``api``api``api` ``` location = /api/test_parallels { content_by_lua_block { local start_time = ngx.now() local res1, res2 = ngx.location.capture_multi({ {"/sum",{args={a=3, b=8}}}, {"/subduction",{args={a=3, b=8}}}, }) ngx.say("status:", res1.status, "response:", res1.body) ngx.say("status:", res2.status, "response:", res2.body) ngx.say("time used:", ngx.now()-start_time) } } ``` ### 1.9 `Nginx``OpenResty`[](https://moonbingbing.gitbooks.io/openresty-best-practices/content/ngx_lua/phase.html) ## confconf`nginx -t -c [conf]` `nginxnginx -s reload -p [path]` ## Reference - [OpenResty ](http://www.stuq.org/course/1015/study) - [OpenResty](http://openresty.org/en/) - [OpenResty](https://github.com/openresty) ## About me [![forthebadge](http://forthebadge.com/images/badges/ages-20-30.svg)](http://forthebadge.com) - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[http://www.answerywj.com](http://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[@AnSwEr](http://weibo.com/1783591593) - CSDN[AnSwEr](http://blog.csdn.net/u011192270) This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. - 4.0

Post._content: `code` ------ ## core `Linux``core``ELF` ## core ### 1. `core` ``` $ ulimit -a ... -c: core file size (blocks) 0 # ... ``` 2. ``` ulimit -c unlimited ulimit -a ... -c: core file size (blocks) unlimited ... ``` 3. `core``blocks``1 block=512 bytes` ``` $ ulimit -c 1024 $ ulimit -a ... -c: core file size (blocks) 1024 ... ``` 4. ``` ulimit -c 0 ulimit -a ... -c: core file size (blocks) 0 ... ``` > `core``/etc/profile` ### `core` ``` echo /MyCoreDumpDir/core.%e.%p > /proc/sys/kernel/core_pattern ``` ``` %p - insert pid into filename # pid %u - insert current uid into filename # uid %g - insert current gid into filename # gid %s - insert signal that caused the coredump into the filename # core %t - insert UNIX time that the coredump occurred into filename # core unix %h - insert hostname where the coredump happened into filename # %e - insert coredumping executable name into filename # ``` > `/proc/sys/kernel/core_uses_pid``%p`,`core``pid` ### `gdb``core``-g` ``` $ gdb a.out ... (gdb) core-file core ... (gdb) bt ... ``` `PC``core``gdb``gdb` ``` $ xxx-xxx-gdb a.out ... (gdb) solib-search-path xxx.so:xxx.so ... (gdb) core-file core ... Post.title: |table
Post._content: `Json``{}``object``[]``array` ## `API``json``key``decode``encode``key` ```lua local cjson = require('cjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} local str = cjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":{}} ``` `cjson``table``object``Lua`(`C/C++, Java`) ## ### `encode_empty_table_as_object` ```lua local cjson = require('cjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} cjson.encode_empty_table_as_object(false) local str = cjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":[]} ``` ### `dkjson` ```lua local dkjson = require('dkjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} local str = dkjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":[]} ``` ### `metatable``table``array` ```lua local cjson = require('cjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} setmetatable(raw.list, cjson.empty_array_mt) local str = cjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":[]} ``` ## Reference - [ array object](https://moonbingbing.gitbooks.io/openresty-best-practices/content/json/array_or_object.html) - [lua CJSONtable](http://blog.csdn.net/ljfrocky/article/details/53034932?_t=t) - [openresty/lua-cjson](https://github.com/openresty/lua-cjson) ## About me [![forthebadge](http://forthebadge.com/images/badges/ages-20-30.svg)](http://forthebadge.com) - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[http://www.answerywj.com](http://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[@AnSwEr](http://weibo.com/1783591593) - CSDN[AnSwEr](http://blog.csdn.net/u011192270) This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. - 4.0
Post.raw: --- title: |table Antuor: AnSwEr(Weijie Yuan) toc: true date: 2017-06-16 15:58:40 categories: Lua tags: lua-cjson --- `Json``{}``object``[]``array` ## `API``json``key``decode``encode``key` ```lua local cjson = require('cjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} local str = cjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":{}} ``` `cjson``table``object``Lua`(`C/C++, Java`) ## ### `encode_empty_table_as_object` ```lua local cjson = require('cjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} cjson.encode_empty_table_as_object(false) local str = cjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":[]} ``` ### `dkjson` ```lua local dkjson = require('dkjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} local str = dkjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":[]} ``` ### `metatable``table``array` ```lua local cjson = require('cjson') local raw = {} raw.name = 'answer' raw.list = {} setmetatable(raw.list, cjson.empty_array_mt) local str = cjson.encode(raw) print('after cjson encode:', str) ``` ``` after cjson encode: {"name":"answer","list":[]} ``` ## Reference - [ array object](https://moonbingbing.gitbooks.io/openresty-best-practices/content/json/array_or_object.html) - [lua CJSONtable](http://blog.csdn.net/ljfrocky/article/details/53034932?_t=t) - [openresty/lua-cjson](https://github.com/openresty/lua-cjson) ## About me [![forthebadge](http://forthebadge.com/images/badges/ages-20-30.svg)](http://forthebadge.com) - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[http://www.answerywj.com](http://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[@AnSwEr](http://weibo.com/1783591593) - CSDN[AnSwEr](http://blog.csdn.net/u011192270) This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. - 4.0

Post.title: LinuxC
Post._content: LinuxC,[](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ/DogFood/tree/master/C/aso). ## welcome.c: ``` #include #include"welcome.h" void welcome() { printf("welcome to my code world!\n"); } ``` > ,. welcome.h: ``` #ifndef _WELCOME_H #define _WELCOME_H void welcome(); #endif ``` > . ## ,() ,,,,, . ## : ``` $ gcc -Wall -O2 -fPIC -I./ -c -o welcome.o welcome.c $ ar crv libwelcome.a welcome.o ``` ar: ``` -r objfile -x objfile -t -d objfile -s -v -c ``` test-sta.c: ``` #include int main(void) { welcome(); return 0; } ``` : ``` $ gcc test-sta.c -o test-sta ./libwelcome.a ``` : ``` $ ./test-sta $ welcome to my code world! ``` ## : ``` $ gcc -o2 -fPIC -shared welcome.c -o libwelcome.so or $ gcc -o2 -fPIC -c welcome.c $ gcc -shared -o libwelcome.so welcome.o ``` : - fPIC : ,. - shared : . ### () test-implicit.c: ``` #include int main() { welcome(); return 0; } ``` > ,. : ``` $ gcc -o2 -Wall -L. -lwelcome test-implicit.c -o test-implicit ``` `test-implicit`,`libwelcome.so`: ``` $ ldd test-implicit linux-vdso.so.1 => (0x00007f0902951000) libwelcome.so => ./libwelcome.so (0x00007f090274f000) libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6 (0x0000003548600000) libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x000000353de00000) libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x0000003548200000) libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x000000353da00000) /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x000000353d600000) ``` ,: ``` $ ./test-implicit $ ./test-implicit: error while loading shared libraries: libwelcome.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory ``` : ``` # $ export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$(pwd):$LD_LIBRARY_PATH # $ ln -s ./libwelcome.so /usr/lib # /etc/ld.so.conf $ sudo echo $(pwd) >> /etc/ld.so.conf $ sudo ldconfig ``` : ``` $ ./test-implicit $ welcome to my code world! ``` ### () test-explicit.c: ``` #include #include #define LIB "./libwelcome.so" int main(void) { /* * RTLD_NOW * RTLD_LAZYdlsym() */ void *dl = dlopen(LIB,RTLD_LAZY); // if (dl == NULL) fprintf(stderr,"Error:failed to load libary.\n"); char *error = dlerror(); // if (error != NULL) { fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",error); return -1; } void (*func)() = dlsym(dl,"welcome"); // error = dlerror(); // if (error != NULL) { fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",error); return -1; } func(); // dlclose(dl); // error = dlerror(); // if (error != NULL) { fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",error); return -1; } return 0; } ``` : ``` $ gcc -ldl test-explicit.c -o test-explicit ``` `test-explicit`,`libwelcome.so`: ``` $ ldd test-explicit linux-vdso.so.1 => (0x00007ffed89e5000) libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x000000353e600000) libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6 (0x0000003548600000) libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x000000353de00000) libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x0000003548200000) libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x000000353da00000) /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x000000353d600000) ``` : ``` $ ./test-explicit $ welcome to my code world! ``` > : . ## Reference - [Linux](http://blog.csdn.net/star_xiong/article/details/17301191) - [Linux](http://hbprotoss.github.io/posts/linuxxia-bian-yi-lian-jie-dong-tai-ku.html) - [Linux(.so)(.a)](http://blog.csdn.net/felixit0120/article/details/7652907) ## About me [![forthebadge](http://forthebadge.com/images/badges/ages-20-30.svg)](http://forthebadge.com) - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[http://www.answerywj.com](http://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[@AnSwEr](http://weibo.com/1783591593) - CSDN[AnSwEr](http://blog.csdn.net/u011192270) This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. - 4.0

Post.title: Linuxadb devices no permissions
Post._content: Linuxadb[](http://pan.baidu.com/s/1qYhBG2w)*/usr/bin* ---------- ## Linuxadb ``` $ adb devices ``` ``` List of devices attached ???????????? no permissions ``` ## ``` $ sudo vi /etc/udev/rules.d/70-android.rules ``` USB ``` $ lsusb Bus 003 Device 011: ID 1f3a:1002 Onda (unverified) ``` ``` SUBSYSTEM=="usb",ATTRS{idVendor}=="1f3a",ATTRS{idProduct}=="1002", MODE="0666" ``` idvendoridProductusbidID 1f3aidVendor 1002 idProduct ``` $ sudo chmod a+x /etc/udev/rules.d/70-android.rules ``` udev ``` $ sudo /etc/init.d/udev restart ``` ``` $ sudo adb kill-server $ adb devices ``` ``` * daemon not running. starting it now on port 5037 * * daemon started successfully * List of devices attached 20080411 device ``` ## About me [![forthebadge](http://forthebadge.com/images/badges/ages-20-30.svg)](http://forthebadge.com) - GitHub[AnSwErYWJ](https://github.com/AnSwErYWJ) - Blog[http://www.answerywj.com](http://www.answerywj.com) - Email[yuanweijie1993@gmail.com](https://mail.google.com) - Weibo[@AnSwEr](http://weibo.com/1783591593) - CSDN[AnSwEr](http://blog.csdn.net/u011192270) This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. - 4.0
